intro: Pelargonium piliferum, commonly known as the woolly geranium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woolly leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Pelargonium piliferum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to withstand drought conditions.
